alert.note: Alert for Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 04 at 8:32PM EST until December 05 at 11:05PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343) affecting Wakulla County. For the Sopchoppy River...including Sopchoppy (FR 343)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343). * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, The Painted Bridge begins to flood at this level. Homes on stilts in low lying areas in the city of Sopchoppy will experience flooding on the ground level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 30.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Monday was 30.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 19.6 feet Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.2 feet on 02/13/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on Tuesday morning.Tuesday afternoon at 245 PM EST.
